title: Area college hockey roundup
content:
Another one-goal victory helped Utica College men create some separation in league play. Justin Derlago scored the game-winning goal with 21 seconds left to help UC drop Manhattanville 3-2 in overtime Saturday in Rye. With the help of a 5-4 win over Neumann on Friday, Utica (12-7) swept the weekend, improving its Eastern College Athletic Conference West record to 8-1 with 16 points. After a scoreless first, Riley Egan's first of two goals came 3:39 into the second. Bryan Platt tied it at 1 for Manhattanville (10-9-1, 6-3) eight minutes later...

Comets earn point in shootout loss to Crunch
UTICA - The Utica Comets closed out their best January in the team's short history on a slightly sour note. However, Saturday's result was another tight one between the Comets and the Syracuse Crunch, their North Division rival. The teams needed extra time to decide a winner for the third time in four meetings this season. It was the Comets that earned only one point. Cory Conacher scored the lone goal in a shootout to help Syracuse edge the Comets 4-3 on Saturday at Utica Memorial Auditorium. The Comets finished the month with an 8-2-1-1 record after falling in their last three games...

Trump, Putin discuss 'mutually beneficial' trade, security
WASHINGTON - President Donald Trump had an hourlong discussion Saturday with Russian President Vladimir Putin - the first since Trump assumed office last week - raising questions over the fate of U.S. sanctions against Moscow and whether the two will look to enhance military cooperation against the Islamic State group. The White House provided a thin readout on the call between the two leaders, saying it was "a significant start to improving the relationship between the United States and Russia that is in need of repair...

Justin Bieber gets hit, bounces back in celeb hockey game
LOS ANGELES - Justin Bieber got a taste of NHL hockey and the Staples Center glass Saturday, courtesy of NHL great Chris Pronger. The pop star responded by showing off skills that would not have looked out of place in his native Canada during a celebrity exhibition game. Bieber was driven into the boards in the first half by a laughing Pronger, who spent 18 years in the league as a hard-nosed defenseman. The singer responded with an empty-net goal and an assist as Team Gretzky beat Team Lemieux 5-3 in the 2017 NHL All-Star Celebrity Shootout...
